00048 /* BMESH_TODO
00049  *
00050  * Date: 2011-11-24 06:25
00051  * Sender: Andrew Wiggin
00052  * Status update: I have code changes to actually make basic bevel modifier work. The things that still need to be done:
00053  * - clean up the changes
00054  * - get bevel by weight and bevel by angles working for vertex only bevel.
00055  * - the code uses adaptations of a couple of bmesh APIs,
00056  * that work a little differently. for example, a join faces that doesn't just create a new face and then delete the
00057  * original two faces and all associated loops, it extends one of the original faces to cover all the original loops
00058  * (except for the loop on the join edge which is of course deleted). the bevel code currently requires this because it
00059  * expects to be able to continue walking loop lists and doesn't like for loops to be deleted out from under it
00060  * while working...
00061  * but bmesh APIs don't do it this way because it makes it trickier to manage the interp during these operations,
00062  * so I need to decide what to do in these cases.
00063  */
00064 
00065 /* BMESH_TODO - resolve this */
00066 #define BMESH_263_VERT_BEVEL_WORKAROUND

00070 BME_TransData_Head *BME_init_transdata(int bufsize)
00071 {
00072     BME_TransData_Head *td;
00073 
00074     td = MEM_callocN(sizeof(BME_TransData_Head), "BM transdata header");
00075     td->gh = BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_ptrhash, BLI_ghashutil_ptrcmp, "BME_init_transdata gh");
00076     td->ma = BLI_memarena_new(bufsize, "BME_TransData arena");
00077     BLI_memarena_use_calloc(td->ma);
00078 
00079     return td;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void BME_free_transdata(BME_TransData_Head *td)
00083 {
00084     BLI_ghash_free(td->gh, NULL, NULL);
00085     BLI_memarena_free(td->ma);
00086     MEM_freeN(td);
00087 }
00088 
00089 BME_TransData *BME_assign_transdata(BME_TransData_Head *td, BMesh *bm, BMVert *v,
00090                                     float *co, float *org, float *vec, float *loc,
00091                                     float factor, float weight, float maxfactor, float *max)
00092 {
00093     BME_TransData *vtd;
00094     int is_new = 0;
00095 
00096     if (v == NULL) {
00097         return NULL;
00098     }
00099 
00100     if ((vtd = BLI_ghash_lookup(td->gh, v)) == NULL && bm != NULL) {
00101         vtd = BLI_memarena_alloc(td->ma, sizeof(*vtd));
00102         BLI_ghash_insert(td->gh, v, vtd);
00103         td->len++;
00104         is_new = 1;
00105     }
00106 
00107     vtd->bm = bm;
00108     vtd->v = v;
00109 
00110     if (co != NULL) {
00111         copy_v3_v3(vtd->co, co);
00112     }
00113 
00114     if (org == NULL && is_new) {
00115         copy_v3_v3(vtd->org, v->co); /* default */
00116     }
00117     else if (org != NULL) {
00118         copy_v3_v3(vtd->org, org);
00119     }
00120 
00121     if (vec != NULL) {
00122         copy_v3_v3(vtd->vec, vec);
00123         normalize_v3(vtd->vec);
00124     }
00125 
00126     vtd->loc = loc;
00127 
00128     vtd->factor = factor;
00129     vtd->weight = weight;
00130     vtd->maxfactor = maxfactor;
00131     vtd->max = max;
00132 
00133     return vtd;
00134 }
00135 
00136 BME_TransData *BME_get_transdata(BME_TransData_Head *td, BMVert *v)
00137 {
00138     BME_TransData *vtd;
00139     vtd = BLI_ghash_lookup(td->gh, v);
00140     return vtd;
00141 }
00142 
00143 /* a hack (?) to use the transdata memarena to allocate floats for use with the max limits */
00144 float *BME_new_transdata_float(BME_TransData_Head *td)
00145 {
00146     return BLI_memarena_alloc(td->ma, sizeof(float));
00147 }

00149 /* ported from before bmesh merge into trunk (was called)
00150  * problem with this is it creates 2 vert faces */
00151 static void BME_Bevel_Dissolve_Disk(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v)
00152 {
00153     BMFace *f;
00154     BMEdge *e;
00155     int done;
00156 
00157     if (v->e) {
00158         done = 0;
00159         while (!done) {
00160             done = 1;
00161             e = v->e; /*loop the edge looking for a edge to dissolve*/
00162             do {
00163                 f = NULL;
00164                 if (BM_edge_is_manifold(e)) {
00165                     f = bmesh_jfke(bm, e->l->f, e->l->radial_next->f, e);
00166                 }
00167                 if (f) {
00168                     done = 0;
00169                     break;
00170                 }
00171                 e = bmesh_disk_edge_next(e, v);
00172             } while (e != v->e);
00173         }
00174         BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v, TRUE);
00175         // bmesh_jekv(bm, v->e, v, FALSE);
00176     }
00177 }
00178 
00179 static int BME_bevel_is_split_vert(BMesh *bm, BMLoop *l)
00180 {
00181     /* look for verts that have already been added to the edge when
00182      * beveling other polys; this can be determined by testing the
00183      * vert and the edges around it for originality
00184      */
00185     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) &&
00186         BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) &&
00187         BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->prev->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG))
00188     {
00189         return 1;
00190     }
00191     return 0;
00192 }
00193 
00194 /* get a vector, vec, that points from v1->co to wherever makes sense to
00195  * the bevel operation as a whole based on the relationship between v1 and v2
00196  * (won't necessarily be a vec from v1->co to v2->co, though it probably will be);
00197  * the return value is -1 for failure, 0 if we used vert co's, and 1 if we used transform origins */
00198 static int BME_bevel_get_vec(float *vec, BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00199 {
00200     BME_TransData *vtd1, *vtd2;
00201 
00202     vtd1 = BME_get_transdata(td, v1);
00203     vtd2 = BME_get_transdata(td, v2);
00204     if (!vtd1 || !vtd2) {
00205         //printf("BME_bevel_get_vec() got called without proper BME_TransData\n");
00206         return -1;
00207     }
00208 
00209     /* compare the transform origins to see if we can use the vert co's;
00210      * if they belong to different origins, then we will use the origins to determine
00211      * the vector */
00212     if (compare_v3v3(vtd1->org, vtd2->org, 0.000001f)) {
00213         sub_v3_v3v3(vec, v2->co, v1->co);
00214         if (len_v3(vec) < 0.000001f) {
00215             zero_v3(vec);
00216         }
00217         return 0;
00218     }
00219     else {
00220         sub_v3_v3v3(vec, vtd2->org, vtd1->org);
00221         if (len_v3(vec) < 0.000001f) {
00222             zero_v3(vec);
00223         }
00224         return 1;
00225     }
00226 }
00227 
00228 /* "Projects" a vector perpendicular to vec2 against vec1, such that
00229  * the projected vec1 + vec2 has a min distance of 1 from the "edge" defined by vec2.
00230  * note: the direction, is_forward, is used in conjunction with up_vec to determine
00231  * whether this is a convex or concave corner. If it is a concave corner, it will
00232  * be projected "backwards." If vec1 is before vec2, is_forward should be 0 (we are projecting backwards).
00233  * vec1 is the vector to project onto (expected to be normalized)
00234  * vec2 is the direction of projection (pointing away from vec1)
00235  * up_vec is used for orientation (expected to be normalized)
00236  * returns the length of the projected vector that lies along vec1 */
00237 static float BME_bevel_project_vec(float *vec1, float *vec2, float *up_vec, int is_forward, BME_TransData_Head *UNUSED(td))
00238 {
00239     float factor, vec3[3], tmp[3], c1, c2;
00240 
00241     cross_v3_v3v3(tmp, vec1, vec2);
00242     normalize_v3(tmp);
00243     factor = dot_v3v3(up_vec, tmp);
00244     if ((factor > 0 && is_forward) || (factor < 0 && !is_forward)) {
00245         cross_v3_v3v3(vec3, vec2, tmp); /* hmm, maybe up_vec should be used instead of tmp */
00246     }
00247     else {
00248         cross_v3_v3v3(vec3, tmp, vec2); /* hmm, maybe up_vec should be used instead of tmp */
00249     }
00250     normalize_v3(vec3);
00251     c1 = dot_v3v3(vec3, vec1);
00252     c2 = dot_v3v3(vec1, vec1);
00253     if (fabsf(c1) < 0.000001f || fabsf(c2) < 0.000001f) {
00254         factor = 0.0f;
00255     }
00256     else {
00257         factor = c2 / c1;
00258     }
00259 
00260     return factor;
00261 }
00262 
00263 /* BME_bevel_split_edge() is the main math work-house; its responsibilities are:
00264  * using the vert and the loop passed, get or make the split vert, set its coordinates
00265  * and transform properties, and set the max limits.
00266  * Finally, return the split vert. */
00267 static BMVert *BME_bevel_split_edge(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v, BMVert *v1, BMLoop *l, float *up_vec, float value, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00268 {
00269     BME_TransData *vtd, *vtd1, *vtd2;
00270     BMVert *sv, *v2, *v3, *ov;
00271     BMLoop *lv1, *lv2;
00272     BMEdge *ne, *e1, *e2;
00273     float maxfactor, scale, len, dis, vec1[3], vec2[3], t_up_vec[3];
00274     int is_edge, forward, is_split_vert;
00275 
00276     /* ov, vtd2, and is_split_vert are set but UNUSED */
00277     (void)ov, (void)vtd2, (void)is_split_vert;
00278 
00279     if (l == NULL) {
00280         /* what you call operator overloading in C :)
00281          * I wanted to use the same function for both wire edges and poly loops
00282          * so... here we walk around edges to find the needed verts */
00283         forward = 1;
00284         is_split_vert = 0;
00285         if (v->e == NULL) {
00286             //printf("We can't split a loose vert's edge!\n");
00287             return NULL;
00288         }
00289         e1 = v->e; /* we just use the first two edges */
00290         e2 = bmesh_disk_edge_next(v->e, v);
00291         if (e1 == e2) {
00292             //printf("You need at least two edges to use BME_bevel_split_edge()\n");
00293             return NULL;
00294         }
00295         v2 = BM_edge_other_vert(e1, v);
00296         v3 = BM_edge_other_vert(e2, v);
00297         if (v1 != v2 && v1 != v3) {
00298             //printf("Error: more than 2 edges in v's disk cycle, or v1 does not share an edge with v\n");
00299             return NULL;
00300         }
00301         if (v1 == v2) {
00302             v2 = v3;
00303         }
00304         else {
00305             e1 = e2;
00306         }
00307         ov = BM_edge_other_vert(e1, v);
00308         sv = BM_edge_split(bm, e1, v, &ne, 0.0f);
00309         //BME_data_interp_from_verts(bm, v, ov, sv, 0.25); /* this is technically wrong.. */
00310         //BME_data_interp_from_faceverts(bm, v, ov, sv, 0.25);
00311         //BME_data_interp_from_faceverts(bm, ov, v, sv, 0.25);
00312         BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, sv, sv->co, sv->co, NULL, sv->co, 0, -1, -1, NULL); /* quick default */
00313         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, sv, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00314         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, ne, BME_BEVEL_ORIG); /* mark edge as original, even though it isn't */
00315         BME_bevel_get_vec(vec1, v1, v, td);
00316         BME_bevel_get_vec(vec2, v2, v, td);
00317         cross_v3_v3v3(t_up_vec, vec1, vec2);
00318         normalize_v3(t_up_vec);
00319         up_vec = t_up_vec;
00320     }
00321     else {
00322         /* establish loop direction */
00323         if (l->v == v) {
00324             forward = 1;
00325             lv1 = l->next;
00326             lv2 = l->prev;
00327             v1 = l->next->v;
00328             v2 = l->prev->v;
00329         }
00330         else if (l->next->v == v) {
00331             forward = 0;
00332             lv1 = l;
00333             lv2 = l->next->next;
00334             v1 = l->v;
00335             v2 = l->next->next->v;
00336         }
00337         else {
00338             //printf("ERROR: BME_bevel_split_edge() - v must be adjacent to l\n");
00339             return NULL;
00340         }
00341 
00342         if (BME_bevel_is_split_vert(bm, lv1)) {
00343             is_split_vert = 1;
00344             sv = v1;
00345             v1 = forward ? l->next->next->v : l->prev->v;
00346         }
00347         else {
00348             is_split_vert = 0;
00349             ov = BM_edge_other_vert(l->e, v);
00350             sv = BM_edge_split(bm, l->e, v, &ne, 0.0f);
00351             //BME_data_interp_from_verts(bm, v, ov, sv, 0.25); /* this is technically wrong.. */
00352             //BME_data_interp_from_faceverts(bm, v, ov, sv, 0.25);
00353             //BME_data_interp_from_faceverts(bm, ov, v, sv, 0.25);
00354             BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, sv, sv->co, sv->co, NULL, sv->co, 0, -1, -1, NULL); /* quick default */
00355             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, sv, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00356             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, ne, BME_BEVEL_ORIG); /* mark edge as original, even though it isn't */
00357         }
00358 
00359         if (BME_bevel_is_split_vert(bm, lv2)) {
00360             v2 = forward ? lv2->prev->v : lv2->next->v;
00361         }
00362     }
00363 
00364     is_edge = BME_bevel_get_vec(vec1, v, v1, td); /* get the vector we will be projecting onto */
00365     BME_bevel_get_vec(vec2, v, v2, td); /* get the vector we will be projecting parallel to */
00366     len = normalize_v3(vec1);
00367 
00368     vtd = BME_get_transdata(td, sv);
00369     vtd1 = BME_get_transdata(td, v);
00370     vtd2 = BME_get_transdata(td, v1);
00371 
00372     if (vtd1->loc == NULL) {
00373         /* this is a vert with data only for calculating initial weights */
00374         if (vtd1->weight < 0.0f) {
00375             vtd1->weight = 0.0f;
00376         }
00377         scale = vtd1->weight / vtd1->factor;
00378         if (!vtd1->max) {
00379             vtd1->max = BME_new_transdata_float(td);
00380             *vtd1->max = -1;
00381         }
00382     }
00383     else {
00384         scale = vtd1->weight;
00385     }
00386     vtd->max = vtd1->max;
00387 
00388     if (is_edge && vtd1->loc != NULL) {
00389         maxfactor = vtd1->maxfactor;
00390     }
00391     else {
00392         maxfactor = scale * BME_bevel_project_vec(vec1, vec2, up_vec, forward, td);
00393         if (vtd->maxfactor > 0 && vtd->maxfactor < maxfactor) {
00394             maxfactor = vtd->maxfactor;
00395         }
00396     }
00397 
00398     dis = BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v1, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) ? len / 3 : len / 2;
00399     if (is_edge || dis > maxfactor * value) {
00400         dis = maxfactor * value;
00401     }
00402     madd_v3_v3v3fl(sv->co, v->co, vec1, dis);
00403     sub_v3_v3v3(vec1, sv->co, vtd1->org);
00404     dis = normalize_v3(vec1);
00405     BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, sv, vtd1->org, vtd1->org, vec1, sv->co, dis, scale, maxfactor, vtd->max);
00406 
00407     return sv;
00408 }
00409 
00410 #if 0 /* UNUSED */
00411 static float BME_bevel_set_max(BMVert *v1, BMVert *v2, float value, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00412 {
00413     BME_TransData *vtd1, *vtd2;
00414     float max, fac1, fac2, vec1[3], vec2[3], vec3[3];
00415 
00416     BME_bevel_get_vec(vec1, v1, v2, td);
00417     vtd1 = BME_get_transdata(td, v1);
00418     vtd2 = BME_get_transdata(td, v2);
00419 
00420     if (vtd1->loc == NULL) {
00421         fac1 = 0;
00422     }
00423     else {
00424         copy_v3_v3(vec2, vtd1->vec);
00425         mul_v3_fl(vec2, vtd1->factor);
00426         if (dot_v3v3(vec1, vec1)) {
00427             project_v3_v3v3(vec2, vec2, vec1);
00428             fac1 = len_v3(vec2) / value;
00429         }
00430         else {
00431             fac1 = 0;
00432         }
00433     }
00434 
00435     if (vtd2->loc == NULL) {
00436         fac2 = 0;
00437     }
00438     else {
00439         copy_v3_v3(vec3, vtd2->vec);
00440         mul_v3_fl(vec3, vtd2->factor);
00441         if (dot_v3v3(vec1, vec1)) {
00442             project_v3_v3v3(vec2, vec3, vec1);
00443             fac2 = len_v3(vec2) / value;
00444         }
00445         else {
00446             fac2 = 0;
00447         }
00448     }
00449 
00450     if (fac1 || fac2) {
00451         max = len_v3(vec1) / (fac1 + fac2);
00452         if (vtd1->max && (*vtd1->max < 0 || max < *vtd1->max)) {
00453             *vtd1->max = max;
00454         }
00455         if (vtd2->max && (*vtd2->max < 0 || max < *vtd2->max)) {
00456             *vtd2->max = max;
00457         }
00458     }
00459     else {
00460         max = -1;
00461     }
00462 
00463     return max;
00464 }
00465 #endif

00467 #if 0 /* UNUSED */
00468 static BMVert *BME_bevel_wire(BMesh *bm, BMVert *v, float value, int res, int UNUSED(options), BME_TransData_Head *td)
00469 {
00470     BMVert *ov1, *ov2, *v1, *v2;
00471 
00472     ov1 = BM_edge_other_vert(v->e, v);
00473     ov2 = BM_edge_other_vert(bmesh_disk_edge_next(v->e, v), v);
00474 
00475     /* split the edges */
00476     v1 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, v, ov1, NULL, NULL, value, td);
00477     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v1, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00478     v2 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, v, ov2, NULL, NULL, value, td);
00479     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v2, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00480 
00481     if (value > 0.5) {
00482         BME_bevel_set_max(v1, ov1, value, td);
00483         BME_bevel_set_max(v2, ov2, value, td);
00484     }
00485 
00486     /* remove the original vert */
00487     if (res) {
00488         /* bmesh_jekv; */
00489 
00490         //void BM_vert_collapse_faces(BMesh *bm, BMEdge *ke, BMVert *kv, float fac, int calcnorm) {
00491         //hrm, why is there a fac here? it just removes a vert
00492         BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, v->e, v);
00493     }
00494 
00495     return v1;
00496 }
00497 #endif
00498 
00499 static BMLoop *BME_bevel_edge(BMesh *bm, BMLoop *l, float value, int UNUSED(options), float *up_vec, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00500 {
00501     BMVert *v1, *v2, *kv;
00502     BMLoop *kl = NULL, *nl;
00503     BMEdge *e, *ke, *se;
00504     BMFace *f, *jf;
00505 
00506     f = l->f;
00507     e = l->e;
00508 
00509     /* sanity check */
00510     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) &&
00511         (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) || BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->next->v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL)))
00512     {
00513         return l;
00514     }
00515 
00516     /* checks and operations for prev edge */
00517     /* first, check to see if this edge was inset previously */
00518     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->prev->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) &&
00519         !BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN))
00520     {
00521         kl = l->prev->radial_next;
00522         kl = (kl->v == l->v) ? kl->prev : kl->next;
00523         kv = l->v;
00524     }
00525     else {
00526         kv = NULL;
00527     }
00528     /* get/make the first vert to be used in SFME */
00529     if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00530         v1 = l->v;
00531     }
00532     else { /* we'll need to split the previous edge */
00533         v1 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, l->v, NULL, l->prev, up_vec, value, td);
00534     }
00535     /* if we need to clean up geometry... */
00536     if (kv) {
00537         se = l->next->e;
00538         jf = NULL;
00539         if (kl->v == kv) {
00540             BM_face_split(bm, kl->f, kl->prev->v, kl->next->v, &nl, kl->prev->e, TRUE);
00541             ke = kl->e;
00542             /* BMESH-TODO: jfke doesn't handle customdata */
00543             jf = bmesh_jfke(bm, kl->prev->radial_next->f, kl->f, kl->prev->e);
00544             BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, ke, kv, FALSE);
00545         }
00546         else {
00547             BM_face_split(bm, kl->f, kl->next->next->v, kl->v, &nl, kl->next->e, TRUE);
00548             ke = kl->e;
00549             /* BMESH-TODO: jfke doesn't handle customdata */
00550             jf = bmesh_jfke(bm, kl->next->radial_next->f, kl->f, kl->next->e);
00551             BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, ke, kv, FALSE);
00552         }
00553         /* find saved loop pointer */
00554         l = se->l;
00555         while (l->f != jf) {
00556             l = l->radial_next;
00557             BLI_assert(l != se->l);
00558         }
00559         l = l->prev;
00560     }
00561 
00562     /* checks and operations for the next edge */
00563     /* first, check to see if this edge was inset previously  */
00564     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->next->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) &&
00565         !BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->next->v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN))
00566     {
00567         kl = l->next->radial_next;
00568         kl = (kl->v == l->next->v) ? kl->prev : kl->next;
00569         kv = l->next->v;
00570     }
00571     else {
00572         kv = NULL;
00573     }
00574     /* get/make the second vert to be used in SFME */
00575     if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->next->v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00576         v2 = l->next->v;
00577     }
00578     else { /* we'll need to split the next edge */
00579         v2 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, l->next->v, NULL, l->next, up_vec, value, td);
00580     }
00581     /* if we need to clean up geometry... */
00582     if (kv) {
00583         se = l->e;
00584         jf = NULL;
00585         if (kl->v == kv) {
00586             BM_face_split(bm, kl->f, kl->prev->v, kl->next->v, &nl, kl->prev->e, TRUE);
00587             ke = kl->e;
00588             /* BMESH-TODO: jfke doesn't handle customdata */
00589             jf = bmesh_jfke(bm, kl->prev->radial_next->f, kl->f, kl->prev->e);
00590             BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, ke, kv, FALSE);
00591         }
00592         else {
00593             BM_face_split(bm, kl->f, kl->next->next->v, kl->v, &nl, kl->next->e, TRUE);
00594             ke = kl->e;
00595             /* BMESH-TODO: jfke doesn't handle customdata */
00596             jf = bmesh_jfke(bm, kl->next->radial_next->f, kl->f, kl->next->e);
00597             BM_vert_collapse_edge(bm, ke, kv, FALSE);
00598         }
00599         /* find saved loop pointer */
00600         l = se->l;
00601         while (l->f != jf) {
00602             l = l->radial_next;
00603             BLI_assert(l != se->l);
00604         }
00605     }
00606 
00607     if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v1, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN) || !BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v2, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00608         BM_face_split(bm, f, v2, v1, &l, e, TRUE);
00609         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00610         l = l->radial_next;
00611     }
00612 
00613     if (l->f != f) {
00614         //printf("Whoops! You got something out of order in BME_bevel_edge()!\n");
00615     }
00616 
00617     return l;
00618 }
00619 
00620 static BMLoop *BME_bevel_vert(BMesh *bm, BMLoop *l, float value, int UNUSED(options), float *up_vec, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00621 {
00622     BMVert *v1, *v2;
00623     /* BMFace *f; */ /* UNUSED */
00624 
00625     /* get/make the first vert to be used in SFME */
00626     /* may need to split the previous edge */
00627     v1 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, l->v, NULL, l->prev, up_vec, value, td);
00628 
00629     /* get/make the second vert to be used in SFME */
00630     /* may need to split this edge (so move l) */
00631     l = l->prev;
00632     v2 = BME_bevel_split_edge(bm, l->next->v, NULL, l->next, up_vec, value, td);
00633     l = l->next->next;
00634 
00635     /* "cut off" this corner */
00636     /* f = */ BM_face_split(bm, l->f, v2, v1, NULL, l->e, TRUE);
00637 
00638     return l;
00639 }
00640 
00641 /*
00642  *          BME_bevel_poly
00643  *
00644  *  Polygon inset tool:
00645  *
00646  *  Insets a polygon/face based on the flagss of its vertices
00647  *  and edges. Used by the bevel tool only, for now.
00648  *  The parameter "value" is the distance to inset (should be negative).
00649  *  The parameter "options" is not currently used.
00650  *
00651  *  Returns -
00652  *  A BMFace pointer to the resulting inner face.
00653  */
00654 static BMFace *BME_bevel_poly(BMesh *bm, BMFace *f, float value, int options, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00655 {
00656     BMLoop *l /*, *o */;
00657     BME_TransData *vtd1, *vtd2;
00658     float up_vec[3], vec1[3], vec2[3], vec3[3], fac1, fac2, max = -1;
00659     int len, i;
00660     BMIter iter;
00661 
00662     zero_v3(up_vec);
00663 
00664     /* find a good normal for this face (there's better ways, I'm sure) */
00665     BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &iter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00666 #ifdef BMESH_263_VERT_BEVEL_WORKAROUND
00667         add_newell_cross_v3_v3v3(up_vec, l->prev->v->co, l->v->co);
00668 #else
00669         BME_bevel_get_vec(vec1, l->v, l->next->v, td);
00670         BME_bevel_get_vec(vec2, l->prev->v, l->v, td);
00671         cross_v3_v3v3(vec3, vec2, vec1);
00672         add_v3_v3(up_vec, vec3);
00673 
00674 #endif
00675     }
00676     normalize_v3(up_vec);
00677 
00678     /* Can't use a BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE iterator here, because the loops are being modified
00679      * and so the end condition will never hi */
00680     for (l = BM_FACE_FIRST_LOOP(f)->prev, i = 0, len = f->len; i < len; i++, l = l->next) {
00681         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) && BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG)) {
00682             max = 1.0f;
00683             l = BME_bevel_edge(bm, l, value, options, up_vec, td);
00684         }
00685         else if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) &&
00686                  BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->v, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) &&
00687                  !BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->prev->e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL))
00688         {
00689             max = 1.0f;
00690             l = BME_bevel_vert(bm, l, value, options, up_vec, td);
00691         }
00692     }
00693 
00694     f = l->f;
00695 
00696     /* max pass */
00697     if (value > 0.5f && max > 0.0f) {
00698         max = -1;
00699         BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &iter, f, BM_LOOPS_OF_FACE) {
00700             if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) || BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, l->e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG)) {
00701                 BME_bevel_get_vec(vec1, l->v, l->next->v, td);
00702                 vtd1 = BME_get_transdata(td, l->v);
00703                 vtd2 = BME_get_transdata(td, l->next->v);
00704                 if (vtd1->loc == NULL) {
00705                     fac1 = 0;
00706                 }
00707                 else {
00708                     copy_v3_v3(vec2, vtd1->vec);
00709                     mul_v3_fl(vec2, vtd1->factor);
00710                     if (dot_v3v3(vec1, vec1)) {
00711                         project_v3_v3v3(vec2, vec2, vec1);
00712                         fac1 = len_v3(vec2) / value;
00713                     }
00714                     else {
00715                         fac1 = 0;
00716                     }
00717                 }
00718                 if (vtd2->loc == NULL) {
00719                     fac2 = 0;
00720                 }
00721                 else {
00722                     copy_v3_v3(vec3, vtd2->vec);
00723                     mul_v3_fl(vec3, vtd2->factor);
00724                     if (dot_v3v3(vec1, vec1)) {
00725                         project_v3_v3v3(vec2, vec3, vec1);
00726                         fac2 = len_v3(vec2) / value;
00727                     }
00728                     else {
00729                         fac2 = 0;
00730                     }
00731                 }
00732                 if (fac1 || fac2) {
00733                     max = len_v3(vec1) / (fac1 + fac2);
00734                     if (vtd1->max && (*vtd1->max < 0 || max < *vtd1->max)) {
00735                         *vtd1->max = max;
00736                     }
00737                     if (vtd2->max && (*vtd2->max < 0 || max < *vtd2->max)) {
00738                         *vtd2->max = max;
00739                     }
00740                 }
00741             }
00742         }
00743     }
00744 
00745     /* return l->f; */
00746     return NULL;
00747 }
00748 
00749 static float BME_bevel_get_angle(BMEdge *e, BMVert *v)
00750 {
00751     BMVert *v1, *v2;
00752     BMLoop *l1, *l2;
00753     float vec1[3], vec2[3], vec3[3], vec4[3];
00754 
00755     l1 = e->l;
00756     l2 = e->l->radial_next;
00757     if (l1->v == v) {
00758         v1 = l1->prev->v;
00759         v2 = l1->next->v;
00760     }
00761     else {
00762         v1 = l1->next->next->v;
00763         v2 = l1->v;
00764     }
00765     sub_v3_v3v3(vec1, v1->co, v->co);
00766     sub_v3_v3v3(vec2, v2->co, v->co);
00767     cross_v3_v3v3(vec3, vec1, vec2);
00768 
00769     l1 = l2;
00770     if (l1->v == v) {
00771         v1 = l1->prev->v;
00772         v2 = l1->next->v;
00773     }
00774     else {
00775         v1 = l1->next->next->v;
00776         v2 = l1->v;
00777     }
00778     sub_v3_v3v3(vec1, v1->co, v->co);
00779     sub_v3_v3v3(vec2, v2->co, v->co);
00780     cross_v3_v3v3(vec4, vec2, vec1);
00781 
00782     normalize_v3(vec3);
00783     normalize_v3(vec4);
00784 
00785     return dot_v3v3(vec3, vec4);
00786 }
00787 
00788 static float BME_bevel_get_angle_vert(BMVert *v)
00789 {
00790     BMIter iter;
00791     BMLoop *l;
00792     float n[3];
00793     float n_tmp[3];
00794     float angle_diff = 0.0f;
00795     float tot_angle = 0.0f;
00796 
00797 
00798     BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &iter, v, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00799         const float angle = BM_loop_calc_face_angle(l);
00800         tot_angle += angle;
00801         BM_loop_calc_face_normal(l, n_tmp);
00802         madd_v3_v3fl(n, n_tmp, angle);
00803     }
00804     normalize_v3(n);
00805 
00806     BM_ITER_ELEM (l, &iter, v, BM_LOOPS_OF_VERT) {
00807         /* could cache from before */
00808         BM_loop_calc_face_normal(l, n_tmp);
00809         angle_diff += angle_normalized_v3v3(n, n_tmp) * BM_loop_calc_face_angle(l);
00810     }
00811 
00812     /* return cosf(angle_diff + 0.001f); */ /* compare with dot product */
00813     return (angle_diff / tot_angle) * (M_PI / 2);
00814 }
00815 
00816 static void BME_bevel_add_vweight(BME_TransData_Head *td, BMesh *bm, BMVert *v, float weight, float factor, int options)
00817 {
00818     BME_TransData *vtd;
00819 
00820     if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00821         return;
00822     }
00823 
00824     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00825     if ((vtd = BME_get_transdata(td, v))) {
00826         if (options & BME_BEVEL_EMIN) {
00827             vtd->factor = 1.0;
00828             if (vtd->weight < 0 || weight < vtd->weight) {
00829                 vtd->weight = weight;
00830             }
00831         }
00832         else if (options & BME_BEVEL_EMAX) {
00833             vtd->factor = 1.0;
00834             if (weight > vtd->weight) {
00835                 vtd->weight = weight;
00836             }
00837         }
00838         else if (vtd->weight < 0.0f) {
00839             vtd->factor = factor;
00840             vtd->weight = weight;
00841         }
00842         else {
00843             vtd->factor += factor; /* increment number of edges with weights (will be averaged) */
00844             vtd->weight += weight; /* accumulate all the weights */
00845         }
00846     }
00847     else {
00848         /* we'll use vtd->loc == NULL to mark that this vert is not moving */
00849         vtd = BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, v, v->co, NULL, NULL, NULL, factor, weight, -1, NULL);
00850     }
00851 }
00852 
00853 static void bevel_init_verts(BMesh *bm, int options, float angle, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00854 {
00855     BMVert *v;
00856     BMIter iter;
00857     float weight;
00858     /* const float threshold = (options & BME_BEVEL_ANGLE) ? cosf(angle + 0.001) : 0.0f; */ /* UNUSED */
00859 
00860     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00861         weight = 0.0f;
00862         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00863             /* modifiers should not use selection */
00864             if (options & BME_BEVEL_SELECT) {
00865                 if (BM_elem_flag_test(v, BM_ELEM_SELECT)) {
00866                     weight = 1.0f;
00867                 }
00868             }
00869             /* bevel weight NYI */
00870             else if (options & BME_BEVEL_WEIGHT) {
00871                 weight = BM_elem_float_data_get(&bm->vdata, v, CD_BWEIGHT);
00872             }
00873             else if (options & BME_BEVEL_ANGLE) {
00874                 /* dont set weight_v1/weight_v2 here, add direct */
00875                 if (BME_bevel_get_angle_vert(v) > angle) {
00876                     weight = 1.0f;
00877                 }
00878             }
00879             else {
00880                 weight = 1.0f;
00881             }
00882 
00883             if (weight > 0.0f) {
00884                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00885                 BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, v, v->co, v->co, NULL, NULL, 1.0, weight, -1, NULL);
00886             }
00887         }
00888     }
00889 }
00890 
00891 static void bevel_init_edges(BMesh *bm, int options, float angle, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00892 {
00893     BMEdge *e;
00894     int count;
00895     float weight;
00896     BMIter iter;
00897     const float threshold = (options & BME_BEVEL_ANGLE) ? cosf(angle + 0.001) : 0.0f;
00898 
00899     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00900         weight = 0.0f;
00901         if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00902             if (options & BME_BEVEL_SELECT) {
00903                 if (BM_elem_flag_test(e, BM_ELEM_SELECT)) {
00904                     weight = 1.0f;
00905                 }
00906             }
00907             else if (options & BME_BEVEL_WEIGHT) {
00908                 weight = BM_elem_float_data_get(&bm->edata, e, CD_BWEIGHT);
00909             }
00910             else if (options & BME_BEVEL_ANGLE) {
00911                 /* dont set weight_v1/weight_v2 here, add direct */
00912                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v1, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN) && BME_bevel_get_angle(e, e->v1) < threshold) {
00913                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00914                     BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v1, 1.0, 1.0, options);
00915                 }
00916                 else {
00917                     BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v1, 0.0, 1.0, options);
00918                 }
00919                 if (!BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v2, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN) && BME_bevel_get_angle(e, e->v2) < threshold) {
00920                     BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00921                     BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v2, 1.0, 1.0, options);
00922                 }
00923                 else {
00924                     BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v2, 0.0, 1.0, options);
00925                 }
00926             }
00927             else {
00928                 weight = 1.0f;
00929             }
00930 
00931             if (weight > 0.0f) {
00932                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00933                 BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v1, weight, 1.0, options);
00934                 BME_bevel_add_vweight(td, bm, e->v2, weight, 1.0, options);
00935             }
00936         }
00937     }
00938 
00939     /* clean up edges with 2 faces that share more than one edg */
00940     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00941         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL)) {
00942             count = BM_face_share_edge_count(e->l->f, e->l->radial_next->f);
00943             if (count > 1) BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL);
00944         }
00945     }
00946 }
00947 
00948 static BMesh *BME_bevel_initialize(BMesh *bm, int options, int UNUSED(defgrp_index), float angle, BME_TransData_Head *td)
00949 {
00950     BMVert *v /*, *v2 */;
00951     BMEdge *e /*, *curedg */;
00952     BMFace *f;
00953     BMIter iter;
00954     int /* wire, */ len;
00955 
00956     /* tag non-manifold geometr */
00957     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
00958         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
00959         if (v->e) {
00960             BME_assign_transdata(td, bm, v, v->co, v->co, NULL, NULL, 0, -1, -1, NULL);
00961             if (!BM_vert_is_manifold(v)) {
00962                 BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00963             }
00964 
00965             /* test wire ver */
00966             len = BM_vert_edge_count(v);
00967             if (len == 2 && BM_vert_is_wire(v))
00968                 BMO_elem_flag_disable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00969         }
00970         else {
00971             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00972         }
00973     }
00974 
00975     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
00976         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
00977         if (!(BM_edge_is_boundary(e) || BM_edge_is_manifold(e))) {
00978             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v1, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00979             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e->v2, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00980             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00981         }
00982         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v1, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN) || BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e->v2, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN)) {
00983             BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_NONMAN);
00984         }
00985     }
00986 
00987     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
00988         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
00989     }
00990 
00991     if (options & BME_BEVEL_VERT) {
00992         bevel_init_verts(bm, options, angle, td);
00993     }
00994     else {
00995         bevel_init_edges(bm, options, angle, td);
00996     }
00997 
00998     return bm;
00999 
01000 }
01001 
01002 #if 0
01003 
01004 static BMesh *BME_bevel_reinitialize(BMesh *bm)
01005 {
01006     BMVert *v;
01007     BMEdge *e;
01008     BMFace *f;
01009     BMIter iter;
01010 
01011     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01012         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
01013     }
01014     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
01015         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
01016     }
01017     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
01018         BMO_elem_flag_enable(bm, f, BME_BEVEL_ORIG);
01019     }
01020     return bm;
01021 
01022 }
01023 
01024 #endif
01025 
01040 static BMesh *BME_bevel_mesh(BMesh *bm, float value, int UNUSED(res), int options, int UNUSED(defgrp_index), BME_TransData_Head *td)
01041 {
01042     BMVert *v;
01043     BMEdge *e, *curedge;
01044     BMLoop *l, *l2;
01045     BMFace *f;
01046     BMIter iter;
01047 
01048     /* unsigned int i, len; */
01049 
01050     /* bevel poly */
01051     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
01052         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, f, BME_BEVEL_ORIG)) {
01053             BME_bevel_poly(bm, f, value, options, td);
01054         }
01055     }
01056 
01057     /* get rid of beveled edge */
01058     BM_ITER_MESH (e, &iter, bm, BM_EDGES_OF_MESH) {
01059         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL) && BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, e, BME_BEVEL_ORIG)) {
01060             BM_faces_join_pair(bm, e->l->f, e->l->radial_next->f, e, TRUE);
01061         }
01062     }
01063 
01064     /* link up corners and cli */
01065     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01066         if (BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_ORIG) && BMO_elem_flag_test(bm, v, BME_BEVEL_BEVEL)) {
01067             curedge = v->e;
01068             do {
01069                 l = curedge->l;
01070                 l2 = l->radial_next;
01071                 if (l->v != v) l = l->next;
01072                 if (l2->v != v) l2 = l2->next;
01073                 if (l->f->len > 3)
01074                     BM_face_split(bm, l->f, l->next->v, l->prev->v, &l, l->e, TRUE);  /* clip this corner off */
01075                 if (l2->f->len > 3)
01076                     BM_face_split(bm, l2->f, l2->next->v, l2->prev->v, &l, l2->e, TRUE);  /* clip this corner off */
01077                 curedge = bmesh_disk_edge_next(curedge, v);
01078             } while (curedge != v->e);
01079             BME_Bevel_Dissolve_Disk(bm, v);
01080         }
01081     }
01082 
01083 #ifdef DEBUG
01084     /* Debug print, remov */
01085     BM_ITER_MESH (f, &iter, bm, BM_FACES_OF_MESH) {
01086         if (f->len == 2) {
01087             printf("%s: warning, 2 edge face\n", __func__);
01088         }
01089     }
01090 #endif
01091 
01092     return bm;
01093 }
01094 
01095 BMesh *BME_bevel(BMEditMesh *em, float value, int res, int options, int defgrp_index, float angle,
01096                  BME_TransData_Head **rtd, int do_tessface)
01097 {
01098     BMesh *bm = em->bm;
01099     BMVert *v;
01100     BMIter iter;
01101 
01102     BME_TransData_Head *td;
01103     BME_TransData *vtd;
01104     int i;
01105     double fac = 1, d;
01106 
01107     td = BME_init_transdata(BLI_MEMARENA_STD_BUFSIZE);
01108     /* recursion math courtesy of Martin Poirier (theeth) */
01109     for (i = 0; i < res - 1; i++) {
01110         if (i == 0) fac += 1.0f / 3.0f; else fac += 1.0f / (3 * i * 2.0f);
01111     }
01112     d = 1.0f / fac;
01113 
01114     for (i = 0; i < res || (res == 0 && i == 0); i++) {
01115         BMO_push(bm, NULL);
01116         BME_bevel_initialize(bm, options, defgrp_index, angle, td);
01117         //if (i != 0) BME_bevel_reinitialize(bm);
01118         bmesh_edit_begin(bm, 0);
01119         BME_bevel_mesh(bm, (float)d, res, options, defgrp_index, td);
01120         bmesh_edit_end(bm, 0);
01121         d /= (i == 0) ? 3.0 : 2.0;
01122         BMO_pop(bm);
01123     }
01124 
01125     /* possibly needed when running as a tool (which is no longer functional)
01126      * but keep as an optioin for now */
01127     if (do_tessface) {
01128         BMEdit_RecalcTessellation(em);
01129     }
01130 
01131     /* interactive preview? */
01132     if (rtd) {
01133         *rtd = td;
01134         return bm;
01135     }
01136 
01137     /* otherwise apply transforms */
01138     BM_ITER_MESH (v, &iter, bm, BM_VERTS_OF_MESH) {
01139         if ((vtd = BME_get_transdata(td, v))) {
01140             if (vtd->max && (*vtd->max > 0 && value > *vtd->max)) {
01141                 d = *vtd->max;
01142             }
01143             else {
01144                 d = value;
01145             }
01146             madd_v3_v3v3fl(v->co, vtd->org, vtd->vec, vtd->factor * d);
01147         }
01148     }
01149 
01150     BME_free_transdata(td);
01151     return bm;
01152 }
